result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick M Gearring

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:47 AM Defendant Frederick M Gearring in court, in custody.  Attorney Tomas Valerio in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn qualifies for SPD but atty has not been appt'd yet. Court explained the process to the defn. Defn made stmts to the court. Court provided defn w/ waiver forms if he wishes to waive at next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:36 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Frederick M Gearring in court, in custody.  Attorney Robin Lee in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes defendant is eligible for SPD but no Atty has been appointed yet. Defendant waives time limits. Court sets for a status conference. Defendant makes statement and request. Court responds as stated for the record.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nathaniel T.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 5

1:46 PM Defendant Frederick M Gearring in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Frederick M Gearring.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Defendant offered Exhibit 1, received by Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
